title: 108_s822
content: The "Child Care Lending Pilot Act of 2003" may be cited as the short title. It establishes the Child Care Business Loan Program. The "Child Care Lending Pilot Act of 2003" establishes the Child Care Business Loan Program under the Small Business Investment Act of 1958, amending section 502 to authorize loans to small, non-profit child care businesses. The Child Care Business Loan Program allows loans to small, non-profit child care businesses, subject to approval by the Administration and meeting eligibility requirements. The Small Business Administration must report on the program's implementation every six months. The Small Business Administration must report on the implementation of the Child Care Business Loan Program every six months to the Senate and House Committees. The report should include the program implementation date, rules issuance date, and the number and amount of loans applied for, approved, and disbursed in the previous 6 months. Additionally, the Comptroller General of the United States is required to submit a report on child care small business loans by March 31, 2006. The Small Business Administration is required to report on the Child Care Business Loan Program every six months to the Senate and House Committees. The report should include information on the program's implementation, effectiveness, participation, marketing, and number of child care small businesses involved. The Small Business Administration must report every six months to Congress on the Child Care Business Loan Program, detailing the number of child care small businesses that applied for, were approved for, and received loans under the program. The report should also include information on the businesses by state, total loan amounts, and average loan terms. The Small Business Administration will issue final rules for the loan program authorized by the Small Business Investment Act of 1958. The amendments made by this section will be in effect until September 30, 2006, applying to loans made during this period.
